00007 #define _SECOND_ORDER_CENTRAL_  "2"
00008 
00009 #define _FOURTH_ORDER_CENTRAL_  "4"

00011 /* One-dimensional second derivative functions: Functions to calculate the
00012  * finite-difference approximation to the second derivative along a given 
00013  * dimension at the cell-centers / grid points.
00014  *
00015  * Arguments:-
00016  *  
00017  *  Df        double*     array containing the approximation to the second derivative
00018  *                        (1D array representing an n-D solution)
00019  *
00020  *  f         double*     array containing the function whose second derivative is to
00021  *                        be computed.
00022  *                        (1D array representing an n-D solution)
00023  *
00024  *  dir       int         dimension (x/y/z/...) along which to compute the second derivative
00025  *
00026  *  s         void*       pointer to an object providing the solver context. The object must
00027  *                        contain at least the following:
00028  *                        ndims     int       number of dimensions
00029  *                        nvars     int       number of elements at each grid location
00030  *                        dim       int*      array of grid size along each dimension 
00031  *                                            (integer array of size ndims)
00032  *                        ghosts    int       number of ghost points
00033  *
00034  *  m         void*       Pointer to an object providing the MPI context. Current not being 
00035  *                        used. This will be required for compact finite-difference methods.
00036  *
00037  *
00038  * Notes:
00039  *
00040  *  + Df and f are arrays with halos / ghost points. However, the second derivative is computed
00041  *    only in the interior. So the ghost points of Df contain uninitialized/unusable values.
00042 */
00043 
00044 /* Second derivative functions */
00045 int SecondDerivativeSecondOrderCentral (double*,double*,int,void*,void*); 
00046 int SecondDerivativeFourthOrderCentral (double*,double*,int,void*,void*);
